intro: Eutrema schulzii, commonly known as the Schultze's sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of linear, glaucous leaves and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime climates. Eutrema schulzii is adapted to salt spray and is an important component of coastal ecosystems.
